newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani rupee ends down in kerb, seen falling.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani rupee ends down in kerb, seen falling.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee ended 0.10 down at 40.95 to the dollar in the kerb market on Tuesday amid lower supplies of the U.S. currency from abroad, dealers said.
The rupee is likely to open lower on Wednesday, one dealer said.
The State (central) bank of Pakistan rate, last changed on October 22, was 40.1200/40.3206 to the dollar.
The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed at 2.40 percent compared to the opening at 2.30 percent.
